content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge on the arete and an awkward right hand sidepull on the face. From there, pull up and match on the softball (cool hold!), and follow through the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Tourbillion's northeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with a high left hand edge and a low right hand edge that is best held as a sidepull even though it isn't. From there, pull with the right hand, stand up to a right hand edge, follow to a left hand edge, finish up the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will do it. The landing is perfect.
content.location: Climbs the center of Tourbillion's north face.

content.description: Sit start with a sloping left hand hold with just enough thumb-catch to make it positive and your right hand on a small, undefined edge. From there, pull up to a right hand three-finger crimp, then reach a left hand sidepull, bump the right hand up through a series of crimps/bumps to reach a jug below the lip, match on it, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate is great, but there is a rock behind where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the south-facing bulge on Tourbillion.

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand rail, a right hand on the arete, and a high right heel hook. From there, pull up and slap a right hand up the arete, follow with your left hand through some edges, gain on foot on the starting hold, then finish up the remaining lichen-covered bumps atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Tourbillion.
